text: in this video you'll see how to automate
backups for aws service catalog products
using aws
backup with this solution you can
standardize resource provisioning with
tags to ensure compliance with backup
policies
select specific resources for backup and
enable self-service
to get started let's navigate to service
catalog as an administrator
for this example we'll use a service
catalog portfolio that contains
reference architecture products
for amazon elastic compute cloud or
amazon ec2
which was obtained from the getting
started library available in the service
catalog console
although we'll be using an ec2 portfolio
as our example
you can enable automatic backups for a
number of different aws services
as you can see we have several products
in this portfolio
to begin setting up backups for the
services in this portfolio
we need to make sure we have a backup
plan in place to set this up let's go to
aws
backup
here you can see ongoing and completed
backup and restore jobs in your account
backup plans can also be enforced on an
organizational scale using the options
in the left navigation pane
for the purposes of this example we'll
create a new backup plan that will only
apply to users in our account
backup plans can be created from a
pre-existing template configured using
the wizard or built using json
we'll use a template that performs
backups daily and retains data for 35
days before deletion
the default backup rule specifies a
daily backup schedule for any resources
it targets based on their tags
tags specified here help organize and
track your backup plan
let's create the plan
we are now ready to assign resources to
protect with our backup
we'll target resources that have the tag
backup equals daily
note that tags are case sensitive
for the purposes of this demo we've gone
ahead and created weekly and monthly
backup plans as well
let's review the daily backup plan we
created
here you can see the backup rule that
was predefined by the backup plan
template
and the resource assignment we created
earlier which has its own iam role
let's look at the backup rule
here you can see a summary of the rule
including its frequency start and
completion parameters and life cycle
this rule specifies a default backup
vault for restore jobs and encrypts the
backup data using a kms
encryption key now let's return to
service catalog to associate our
resource assignments with our service
catalog portfolio
to make sure that each resource
provisioned is tagged for backups
we'll create tag options in service
catalog specific for backups that occur
daily
weekly and monthly
now let's go to the portfolio
let's enable the provisioning of
resources in this portfolio through
self-service
to do this we'll ensure that any groups
roles or users we want to be able to
provision products are associated with
the portfolio
for the purposes of this example a
developer's group has already been added
now let's associate our three tag
options
this will make it a requirement that
backup tags are selected during
provisioning
to associate resources to the correct
backup plan
with this feature you don't have to rely
on dev teams remembering this step
as it is enforced through service
catalog
now whenever a service catalog user
provisions a product from this portfolio
they must specify one of the three tag
option values corresponding to the
backup plans we defined
let's switch to the perspective of a
developer and provision an amazon ec2
linux instance from service catalog
three tags are required to provision the
instance the first tag corresponds to
the backup plan
we'll specify the daily backups tag for
our ec2 instance
the other two tags were predefined in
the service catalog reference
architecture as well
let's launch the product
after a few minutes the provisioning is
finished successfully
now let's switch back to the
administrators view to look at the job
status
we can see that the backup job is
running for the ec2 instance we just
provisioned
later we can see that the backup job is
complete and view its details including
its backup size
and creation and completion date
you've just seen how to automate backups
for aws service catalog products using
aws backup
thanks for watching now it's your turn
to try
